meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a heavy blow.
meanings.sent1: He wallops the ball with great force.
meanings.sent2: She wallops the nail into the wood.
meanings.sent3: The hammer wallops the nail like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: The storm wallops the coast with powerful waves.
meanings.sent5: The boxer wallops his opponent with a knockout punch.

meanings.sent1: The tree branch received a wallops from the strong wind.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler delivered a powerful wallop to his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected snowball wallops caught him off guard.
meanings.sent4: The final wallops of the drum signaled the end of the performance.
meanings.sent5: The baseball player felt the wallops of the ball against his glove.

meanings.sent1: The team wallops their opponents in the championship game.
meanings.sent2: She wallops her rival in the debate competition.
meanings.sent3: The cat wallops the mouse in their playful chase.
meanings.sent4: The company wallops the competition with their innovative product.
meanings.sent5: The hero wallops the villain in the final showdown.
